availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Constructed in Indianapolis, Indiana, in April 1862. Established by Adjutant General Lew Wallace. Served as a military camp and prison camp from April 1862 to July 1865. Commanded by Colonel Richard Owen from 1862 to 1865.

ab.bibl:
“Camp Morton,” Discover Indiana, April 2, 2019, Indiana Division of Historic Preservation and Archaeology, accessed October 15, 2021,
https://publichistory.iupui.edu/items/show/259?tour=30&index=17.

John A. Wyeth, "Horrors Of Camp Morton" Southern Historical Society Papers, vol. 18 (Jan. 1890 - Dec. 1890), 328–33.
